page.title: 04CHANGING FACE OF THURNSCOE
page.content: Before the turn of the century Thurnscoe was an{agricultural}village. Since, the main industry has been{coal {mining.}There are a few other small, light industries in the area but there have been no new industries in the Thurnscoe area in recent years. There is a purpose built{industrial {estate}in Thurnscoe but unfortunately only a few factory units have been used. There is a{sewing factory}at the East end of Thurnscoe. The Factory has been open for eight to nine years and they make clothes for Marks and Spencers. They also make clothes for British Home Stores. There is a {printing factory}also called Finley Swiffen and Co. The main thing it prints is raffle tickets. There is a little factory up at the East end that mends radios and makes tape recorders called Mchenzie Accoustics.
